greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Index of column where n is located in array A276953 (equally: row in A276955).
comment: a(0) = 0 by convention, because 0 is not present in arrays A276953 and A276955.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5040
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
formula: a(0) = 0; for n >= 1, if A260736(n) > 0 [when A276950(n) is not zero, when n is in A273670], then a(n) = A276952(n) = 1 + A273663(n), otherwise a(n) = a(A266193(n)).
program: (Scheme) (definec (A276951 n) (cond ((zero? n) n) ((not (zero? (A276950 n))) (A276952 n)) (else (A276951 (A266193 n)))))
xref: Cf. arrays A276953 & A276955. A276949 gives their other index.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2016
